question_sentence: Who was named People’s Sexiest Man Alive of 2023?
evidence: The 57-year-old “Grey’s Anatomy” star said he was "glad it's happening at this point in my life", after being unveiled by People as this year's winner. Dempsey is the magazine's first Sexiest Man Alive since 2019 who isn't part of the Marvel Universe, with Chris Evans, Paul Rudd and Michael B. Jordan claiming the title over the past three years.

question_sentence: US food giant Tyson Foods recalled 30,000lb (13,600kg) of which product over contamination fears?
evidence: Tyson, the largest US meat producer by sales, announced the voluntary recall last weekend after some consumers reported finding small pieces of metal in the "Fun Nuggets". The US Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) said it had received one report of a "minor oral injury" related to the consumption of the chicken patties.

question_sentence: Which member of the UK shadow cabinet branded Suella Braverman as "out of control" after the home secretary publicly criticised the Met Police?
evidence: Braverman claimed in an op-ed for The Times that there was a "perception" of senior officers in the London police force "playing favourites with protesters". In a tweeted response, shadow home secretary Cooper criticised the "highly irresponsible and dangerous attempt to undermine respect for the police during a sensitive time".

question_sentence: Which baseball veteran did the Los Angeles Angels hire to replace Phil Nevin as manager?
evidence: The 71-year-old is now the oldest manager in major league baseball and only the second active black manager, joining Dave Roberts of the Los Angeles Dodgers. Former Angels boss Nevin was not re-signed when his contract expired last month, after one and a half losing seasons in charge of the long-struggling team.

question_sentence: The longest-ever strike by Hollywood actors ended after how many days?
evidence: The SAG-AFTRA union, which represents more than 60,000 Hollywood actors, announced on Wednesday that the four-month strike was ending, after agreeing a tentative deal with studios and streaming companies.The proposed agreement would give actors larger minimum-pay increases, a streaming bonus and "consent and compensation" provisions against AI.

question_sentence: Which US state became the 24th to legalise recreational marijuana?
evidence: More than 2.1 million Ohio voters, or 57%, this week approved a measure legalising recreational marijuana, defying Republican legislative leaders who had failed to pass the proposed law. The passage of Issue 2 allows adults over the age of 21 to use, purchase and possess the drug for non-medical purposes.

question_sentence: Which sports brand faced a backlash after claiming its £45 trainers for babies "help promote natural foot development"?
evidence: The sports giant claims its Swoosh 1 trainers "can help promote natural foot development", but experts said "the necessity of wearing trainers is questionable" for babies. For more stories from the stranger side of life, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which pop star used their WhatsApp fan channel to criticise an AI-generated TikTok song that mimics their voice?
evidence: The Puerto Rican rap and reggaetón star – real name Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio – joins Drake and other artists in voicing concerns over AI-produced music. In a message posted on his WhatsApp channel on Monday, Bad Bunny said anyone who liked the soundalike song did not "deserve to be my friends".

question_sentence: The NHS is "repurposing" breast cancer treatment Anastrozole as a preventative pill after the drug was found to cut post-menopausal women's risk of the disease by how much?
evidence: Anastrozole has been available for years as a breast cancer treatment, but will now be offered to tens of thousands of women as a preventative option after becoming the first drug to be relicensed as part of NHS England's Medicines Repurposing Programme. The 4p-a-day pill will be offered to women with a moderate to high risk of developing the disease, which is the most common cancer in the UK.

question_sentence: Which two countries are hosting the 2023 Gay Games?
evidence: The latest edition of the Gay Games, held every four years, was initially slated for last November but was delayed due to Hong Kong's strict pandemic curbs. The event, which celebrates LGBTQ+ sports and culture, finally kicked off last Friday, with the Mexican city of Guadalajara added as a co-host. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: How many Republican candidates participated in the presidential debate this week?
evidence: Five presidential candidates met the criteria to participate in Wednesday’s third primary debate in Miami. Former President Trump, the party’s front-runner, skipped the debate.

question_sentence: Which labor union ended a historic strike this week?
evidence: SAG-AFTRA, the union that represents about 160,000 actors, reached a tentative deal with Hollywood film and TV studios, ending a monthslong strike.

question_sentence: Which city was enveloped in a blanket of toxic smog this week?
evidence: A toxic haze in the Indian capital of New Delhi reached hazardous levels for several consecutive days this week. The airborne particle pollution reached PM 2.5 — a concentration nearly 80 times the World Health Organization’s recommended limit.

question_sentence: Workers in which field are resigning at an alarming rate in the US due to threats and harassment?
evidence: A growing exodus of local election officials is raising alarms ahead of the 2024 presidential contest. Many are leaving their local roles amid a spike in harassment and partisan interference in their duties.

question_sentence: Which state said “yes” to making abortion a constitutional right?
evidence: Ohio became the latest state to enshrine abortion rights — becoming the first Republican state to make such a move.

question_sentence: More than 30,000 pounds of which food product were recently recalled?
evidence: Tyson Foods recalled over 30,000 pounds of chicken nuggets after some consumers reported finding small metal pieces in their dinosaur-shaped patties.

question_sentence: Phone networks and internet connections were down for millions Wednesday in which country?
evidence: Australia’s second-largest telecommunications provider experienced an unexplained nationwide outage, creating chaotic service disruptions. Train networks, rideshare companies, banks and hospitals across the country were impacted for hours.

question_sentence: America’s banking system was widely impacted this week by which issue?
evidence: Since last week, frustrated customers have reported direct deposit payment problems at Bank of America, Chase, US Bank and Wells Fargo, to name a few.

question_sentence: Which popular video game is being developed into a live-action film?
evidence: The popular video game “The Legend of Zelda” is coming to life in a new live-action movie, Nintendo announced.

question_sentence: A hit song from 1988 won big at the Country Music Awards this week. Which was it?
evidence: Tracy Chapman’s 1988 hit “Fast Car” won song of the year at the CMAs, thanks to a cover by Luke Combs that brought the tune back into the spotlight.

question_sentence: What led to the cancellation of St. Helena's annual carnival after 60 years?
What are the key ingredients in Baskin Robbins' Flavor of the Month, offering a taste of Thanksgiving in one scoop?
What is the focus of Delaware State University's contribution to the Lunar Land Rover Mission funded by a $899,000 grant from NASA?
Why has New Castle County in Delaware become a hotspot for Mexican food, particularly known for its excellent carnitas and birria tacos?
Why are Dolly Parton's "Rockstar" movie tickets cheaper in Delaware compared to cities in surrounding states?
What prompted the shooting incident in Wilmington?
What aspect of Jamin Pugh's legacy was recently honored in Laurel, Delaware?
What unusual fear does Jason Kelce admit to during a recent episode of the "New Heights" podcast?
Bill Irvin, owner of The Brandywine Restaurant, was inspired by classic elegance and a dining experience from the '50s and '60s. What is the special place he aimed to create with this restaurant?
What incident initially brought Timothy Edward Olschafskie to the attention of Delaware authorities on March 11?
